intro: Mastixia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved mastix, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
